Best Answer - Chosen by Voters The point in sending him to prison would be so he is not out enjoying his life knowing that he has a child out there that he is refusing to care for and he is just being a deadbeat. If he is in prison for NON payment, obviously he wasn't paying to begin with. Not only that, but if he were taking care of his responsibilities, he wouldn't be on child support in the first place. It should be a felony, that way it can be a lesson to the many other men out there to wear condoms so they don't create children they don't want to support. 3 years ago Report Abuse 50% 2 Votes 1 person rated this as good

Other Answers (3) Show: All Answers Oldest to Newest Newest to Oldest Rated Highest to Lowest by scott b Member since: July 18, 2007 Total points: 114,834 (Level 7) Add Contact Block Because, the idea of a prison term is a deterrent for people to not cheat and refuse to pay. 3 years ago Report Abuse 25% 1 Vote 1 person rated this as good by John Member since: April 23, 2009 Total points: 169 (Level 1) Add Contact Block you sould be so ashamed that you would pay child support that jail would be more like sanctuary than a sentence. what the hell if a real man"helps"make a child than he should be man enough to be responsible to answer yes they can and yes they should sorry bastards 3 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes 1 person rated this as good by E-ma Member since: February 16, 2009 Total points: 45,665 (Level 7) Add Contact Block I don't know the class of the crime (felony or what), but prison DOES have lots of dead-beat parents behind bars.
It's usually a parent who refused to pay anyway so no support has stopped b/c it never began. Thus prison is time to think about keeping priorities straight like paying support&keeping one's freedom.
In cases of garnished wages, some support paying parents will either work"under the table"(not declaring any income) or they keep a part-time job in low pay to avoid the big bucks they'd earn in their university degreed profession. That's call being deliberately under employed. Both are illegal.
Child support where I live starts as low as 25% of a minimum wage job&upwards with number of children&education level of parent. This is to urge them to get into field of training that will most benefit the children.
Again, jail is usually reserved for those who have not been paying or are under paying. In jail they lose their part-time job&will want to make up time going for the medical research job that they were trained for&will make more money in. Source(s): EDIT to being under-employed. SOLE reason must be that parent does not WANT to pay. This an EXCUSABLE example. You're trained to do technical work in NASA for $100, 000 a year. Job is 850 miles from your child. But you decline job b/c that means work hours&travel won't allow you to be available for all of your scheduled visitations. Parenting IS more important than money. In your town, there are only 5 jobs. 4 at fast-food restaurant for minimum wage&one at the coal mines for 5x's the pay, but you are really allergic to coal dust. Staying healthy for your child IS more imortant than the extra pay. So that leaves a $100,000 trained parent making minimum wage&it's still acceptable b/c child was put 1st in decision process, NOT avoiding support payments. 3 years ago Report Abuse 25% 1 Vote
